definition[0]: a series of questions that someone asks you in a threatening or unpleasant way
example[0]: I had to face a two-hour inquisition from my parents about where I’d been.
definition[1]: an official Roman Catholic organization which tried to find and punish heretics (=people with unacceptable religious beliefs) during the Middle Ages, and which is known for the cruel ways that it tortured(torture) and killed people. The most famous part of the organization was the Spanish Inquisition, led in the 15th century by Tomás de Torquemada.
